# What Are Brainstorming Techniques?

Brainstorming techniques are structured methods used to generate ideas and solve problems collectively. These techniques encourage free thinking and collaboration, allowing team members to build on each other's ideas and come up with innovative solutions. From mind maps to role-playing, each technique offers a unique approach to harnessing the groupâ€™s creative energy.


# Analytic Brainstorming Techniques


### 1. [Mind Mapping](https://affine.pro/blog/top-5-mind-maps-examples-and-tools)


This technique involves creating a visual diagram that represents ideas, words, tasks, or other items linked to and arranged around a central concept. By forming these connections, mind mapping helps in visualizing and structuring thoughts, making it easier to analyze and generate new ideas.



![pMYKE2ArvTLwAZSFkOkL3WDSK5-AFH7-7AVf56gaqHM=](/blobs/pMYKE2ArvTLwAZSFkOkL3WDSK5-AFH7-7AVf56gaqHM=)


### 2. Gap Filling, a.k.a. Gap Analysis


Gap analysis is a method of assessing the difference between the current situation and the desired goals. It's a powerful tool for identifying what needs to be done to move a project forward and can stimulate creative solutions to bridge these gaps.



![AX3kt0y6zcI38Xz472GB8QNDsab7chefaq1U2YhVJhU=](/blobs/AX3kt0y6zcI38Xz472GB8QNDsab7chefaq1U2YhVJhU=)


### 3. Starbursting


Starbursting encourages teams to generate questions about the product, service, or issue at hand. By brainstorming questions rather than answers, you can gain a more comprehensive understanding of the challenge and think of more creative solutions.



![mdsN0Zl2z4N8P4szkC9ooFfdssaGTWrdXSJMryOhpHY=](/blobs/mdsN0Zl2z4N8P4szkC9ooFfdssaGTWrdXSJMryOhpHY=)


### 4. The Five Whys, a.k.a. Why Analysis


This technique involves asking 'why' repeatedly to uncover the root cause of a problem. It can lead to deeper insights and foster innovative thinking as teams delve into the underlying issues.



![A4p0iTWszCQjrBxFR8UX4oGmYNymuV-4hu0KlSbdfkw=](/blobs/A4p0iTWszCQjrBxFR8UX4oGmYNymuV-4hu0KlSbdfkw=)


### 5. [SWOT](https://affine.pro/blog/top-10-free-editable-swot-analysis-template-examples) Analysis


[SWOT](https://affine.pro/blog/top-10-free-editable-swot-analysis-template-examples) stands for Strengths, Weaknesses, Opportunities, and Threats. This classic business tool can also be used creatively to analyze these four aspects of a project and generate strategic ideas.



![YrWaKrPZ1SxuzKUbMcyv0bxMkPkI49ZDULdKiOE1YwY=](/blobs/YrWaKrPZ1SxuzKUbMcyv0bxMkPkI49ZDULdKiOE1YwY=)


### 6. How Now Wow


This matrix separates ideas into three categories: 'How' (basic but practical), 'Now' (innovative and feasible), and 'Wow' (groundbreaking but may require more development). It helps in categorizing and prioritizing ideas during a brainstorming session.



![VK3XHHQkQG7edeLXJugKOm1pqib6pul4UZNMm2ZX9Gs=](/blobs/VK3XHHQkQG7edeLXJugKOm1pqib6pul4UZNMm2ZX9Gs=)


### 7. Drivers Analysis


This technique looks at the drivers or factors that can influence a project or problem. Understanding these drivers can lead to more targeted and creative solutions.



![BGX5M63DR3xVfYkpSwuD7_KNWSa3EOds8OHnA8w941w=](/blobs/BGX5M63DR3xVfYkpSwuD7_KNWSa3EOds8OHnA8w941w=)


### 8. Role Storming


Role storming involves putting oneself in someone else's shoes to view problems and generate solutions from a different perspective. This can lead to unexpected and creative ideas.
